metadata.title: CVE-2024-31460 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Cacti provides an operational monitoring and fault management framework.Prior to version 1.2.27, some of the data stored in`automation_tree_rules.php` is not thoroughly checked and is used toconcatenate the SQL statement in `create_all_header_nodes()`  function from`lib/api_automation.php` , finally resulting in SQL injection. Using SQLbased secondary injection technology, attackers can modify the contents ofthe Cacti database, and based on the modified content, it may be possibleto achieve further impact, such as arbitrary file reading, and even remotecode execution through arbitrary file writing. Version 1.2.27 contains apatch for the issue.

criterions.comment: cacti package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
